label: AB2C4D_mP32_14_e_2e_4e_e-001
title: Monoclinic (II) Li$_{2}$FeSiO$_{4}$ Structure
comments:
This is the monoclinic structure of (Masese, 2015). (Nishimura, 2008) find an alternative structure \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4D_mP32_4_2a_4a_8a_2a-001}{in space group $P2_{1}$ \#4}. 
 Li$_{2}$FeSiO$_{4}$ is also known to exist in the orthorhombic \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4C_oP16_31_ab_2ab_a-002}{$\beta$-Li$_{3}$PO$_{4}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4D_oP32_62_c_d_2cd_c-001}{Li$_{2}$CdSiO$_{4}$} structures. (Boulineau, 2010). 
 (Masese, 2015) give the structure in the $P2_{1}/n$ setting of space group \#14. We use FINDSYM to translate this to the standard $P2_{1}/c$ setting. 
 (Masese, 2015) label the oxygen atoms as being on (4a) Wyckoff sites, but they are actually on (4e) sites, as are all the other atoms in this structure.
